headline.summary: The pledge will assist some 12.2 million people, including 5.6 million children, twelve times more than when the crisis erupted four years ago. Ninety percent of funds from the January 2014 pledge have already been disbursed.

headline.summary: Kuwait and the EU pledged Tuesday around 1.6 billion euros ($1.7 billion) to help alleviate war-torn Syria's humanitarian crisis at a meeting aimed at raising $8.4 billion this year.
headline.title: EU, Kuwait pledge 1.6 bn euros in Syria humanitarian aid

fields.title: Syria aid pledges hit $3.8 bn: UN chief

headline.summary: Some $121 million are urgently needed to prevent further deterioration of the food security situation amidst the ongoing crisis in Syria, which has left some 9.8 million people food insecure.

headline.summary: Oxfam has calculated that nearly half of the world’s top donors didn’t give their fair share of aid in 2014. Wealthy countries meeting on Tuesday in Kuwait to pledge aid must dig deeper than last year, Oxfam says.

headline.summary: Across Syria, 57% of public hospitals are only partially functioning or completely out of service. WHO is appealing for US$ 124 million to continue its support to health services.

headline.summary: In a briefing to the Security Council, Valerie Amos said that at a time when needs were growing, the Government continued to put in place measures that are not practical and slow down the humanitarian response.

headline.summary: The ongoing conflict increases the risk of potentially hazardous chemicals being released into the environment, with consequent impacts on health. The Environment Ministry is working to speed up remediation work to limit air, soil and water pollution.

Iraq is suffering from the displacement of an estimated 1.8m people since the start of 2014, 40 percent of whom are staying in tents, collective shelters and unfinished or open-air spaces.
